intro: Mascagnia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Mascagnia parvifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
